page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF BLOCK.
page.content: The block is situated in Lancashire in agion called "the Fylde". As the derivation of the name suggests it is mainly composed of fields. To the north of the block are the outskirts of the village of Wrea Green and the southerly edge of the old cotton and flax spinning town of Kirkham. The main A583 Preston to Blackpool trunk road passes through this section. To the south of the block is the northerly edge of the village of Freckleton which at one time was a thriving port on the River Ribble. The main A584 Preston to Lytham St.Annes trunk road passes through this section.. The remainder of the block abounds with typical fields except for Kirkham Open Prison situated on the Freckleton Road.
